body_html:
Found a solution, in my case it was related to Windows 10 and Pycharm.
Somehow Pycharm doesn't have access to Program Files in Windows 10 if you don't run it as admin and this is default location of CUDA folder and all dlls .
I closed all my projects and opened Pycharm as admin and suddenly everything works.

Also I edited two lines of build_info.py of tensorflow module:

cudart_dll_name = 'C:\Program Files\NVIDIA GPU Computing Toolkit\CUDA\v9.0\bin\cudart64_90.dll'
cudnn_dll_name = 'C:\Program Files\NVIDIA GPU Computing Toolkit\CUDA\v9.0\bin\cudnn64_7.dll'

Hope it helps!

Somehow Pycharm doesn't have access to Program Files in Windows 10 if you don't run it as admin and this is default location of CUDA folder and all dlls .
I closed all my projects and opened Pycharm as admin and suddenly everything works.
Also I edited two lines of build_info.py of tensorflow module:
cudart_dll_name = 'C:\Program Files\NVIDIA GPU Computing Toolkit\CUDA\v9.0\bin\cudart64_90.dll'
cudnn_dll_name = 'C:\Program Files\NVIDIA GPU Computing Toolkit\CUDA\v9.0\bin\cudnn64_7.dll'
Hope it helps!
body:
Found a solution, in my case it was related to Windows 10 and Pycharm.
Somehow Pycharm doesn't have access to Program Files in Windows 10 if you don't run it as admin and this is default location of CUDA folder and all dlls .
I closed all my projects and opened Pycharm as admin and suddenly everything works.

Also I edited two lines of build_info.py of tensorflow module:

cudart_dll_name = 'C:\\Program Files\\NVIDIA GPU Computing Toolkit\\CUDA\\v9.0\\bin\\cudart64_90.dll'
cudnn_dll_name = 'C:\\Program Files\\NVIDIA GPU Computing Toolkit\\CUDA\\v9.0\\bin\\cudnn64_7.dll'

Hope it helps!
